required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Goal Attainment Scaling in Upper Limb Spasticity Treatment
clinical_study.official_title: Goal Attainment Scaling in Upper Limb Spasticity Treatment With Botulinum Toxin and the Influence of Regular Exercise for Spastic Upper Limb on Quality of Life in Patients After Stroke

lead_sponsor.agency: University Rehabilitation Institute, Republic of Slovenia

clinical_study.source: University Rehabilitation Institute, Republic of Slovenia

brief_summary.textblock: Patients after stroke with upper limb spasticity treated with botulinum toxin-A (BTX-A) will be included in this two-part study. In the first part, goal attainment scaling and comprehensive assessment of motor functioning will be performed before BTX-A application and after two weeks. In the second part, the patients will be randomised into a test group performing prescribed regular exercise for two weeks and a control group exercising at their own discretion during the same period, whereby the patients' health-related quality of life will be assessed at the beginning and end of the two-week period.

detailed_description.textblock: Goal setting will be performed by the patient together with the physician according to the SMART principle (specific, measureable, achievable, realistic, time bound). The goals will be classified according to the International Classification of Functioning, Disability and Health. Goal attainment will be assessed using the Goal Attainment Scale - Light. Comprehensive assessment of motor functioning will address range of motion, spasticity, pain, degree of motor disability and degree of dependence in daily activities. The prescribed exercises for the test group will be passive or active, depending on spasticity of the impaired upper limb. Both groups will keep an Exercise Diary during the second part of the study.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: First part: observational study. Second part: parallel groups.

primary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline, after 2 weeks (i.e., at the end of the 1st part of the study)
primary_outcome.description: Change in Goal Attainment Scale - Light

primary_outcome.time_frame: Start of the 2nd part of the study (i.e., after 2 weeks), end of the 2nd part of the study (i.e., after 4 weeks)
primary_outcome.description: Change in Spasticity Related Quality of Life Tool score

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Start of the 2nd part of the study (i.e., after 2 weeks), end of the 2nd part of the study (i.e., after 4 weeks)
Start of the 2nd part of the study (i.e., after 2 weeks), end of the 2nd part of the study (i.e., after 4 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: Change in Modified Ashworth Scale score

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Start of the 2nd part of the study (i.e., after 2 weeks), end of the 2nd part of the study (i.e., after 4 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: Difference in Penn Spasm Frequency Scale

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Start of the 2nd part of the study (i.e., after 2 weeks), end of the 2nd part of the study (i.e., after 4 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: Change in pain rating on the Visual Analog Scale

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Start of the 2nd part of the study (i.e., after 2 weeks), end of the 2nd part of the study (i.e., after 4 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: Change in Brunnstrom Stage of Recovery score

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Start of the 2nd part of the study (i.e., after 2 weeks), end of the 2nd part of the study (i.e., after 4 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: Change in Modified Rankin Scale score

intervention.description: Active or passive exercises for the spastic upper limb, including functional electrical stimulation (FES), performed regularly for two weeks.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patient's or caregiver's approval
- ischemic or hemorrhagic stroke diagnosed using head CT/MRI
- at least one upper limb muscle spasticity (MAS ≥ 3)
- candidate for BTX-A treatment or already given BTX-A in the past
- patient's or caregiver's capability for goal attainment protocol cooperation (Mini Mental Examination ≥ 24 points)
Exclusion Criteria:
- aphasic patients without caregiver's presence
- other neurological or musculoskeletal diseases that could affect the treatment outcome

overall_official.affiliation: University Rehabilitation Institute, Republic of Slovenia

facility.name: University Rehabilitation Institute, Republic of Slovenia
